title: Khonsu Amulet
description:
Gold figure, roughly lenticular in section, worked on both the front and rear surfaces. Represented is a seated mummiform falcon-headed diety, possibly Khonsu-Re. The god is crowned with lunar crescent, solar disk and one side, a uraeus. On the other side the uraeus is replaced by an eyelet. The body, crescent, disk, uraeus and eyelet were all made separately. 
Condition: Small nicks and pits; otherwise good.
section: The Ptolemaic Period and the Beginning of the Roman Period

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
